s.text: As this shield is experimentally removed through deletion of CSN subunits, Pcu3p may accumulate in the neddylated state.

Interestingly, fission yeast caa1/csn1 deletion mutants show a set of defects, which partially overlaps that found in pcu3 disruptants: slow growth, cell elongation, and sensitivity to UV-irradiation, but not hydroxyurea [ 6, 21].
Deletion of pcu1 and pcu3 results either in lethality or in severe growth retardation, respectively [ 6].

With respect to the recent implication of CSN in cullin regulation [ 10], we considered the possibility that the overlapping phenotypes of csn1 and pcu3 mutants could arise from interference with Pcu3p function.
2C, 2D), where both cullins seem constitutively neddylated, argues against a critical role for dynamic cycles of neddylation and deneddylation in cullin function in fission yeast.
This mutant Csn5p retained full activity for preventing Pcu1p and Pcu3p hyperneddylation (Fig.
2C, 2D), thereby underscoring the significance of our finding that all CSN subunits tested here are involved in cullin regulation.
To date, no distinct biochemical activity has been identified that can reconcile this diversity in CSN functions.
We can therefore not exclude that CSN's role in the control of Pcu3p neddylation differs from its role established for Pcu1p [ 10].
It is likely that some subunits have very specialized functions within the complex, while others are required for its broader activities such as control of cullin neddylation.
It thus appears that part of the diversification of CSN function may arise from formation of smaller subcomplexes.
